AssetClass.title: Asset Class
AssetClass.description: As defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015); Character #2

InstrumentType.title: Instrument Type
InstrumentType.description: As defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015); Character #1

UseCase.title: Product
UseCase.description: Unique label that defines the product

Level.description: Label assigned to the UPI to describe its level in the hierarchy
Level.title: Level

elaboration.New: New record added to the database
elaboration.Updated: One/several of the fields in the record is/are updated
elaboration.Expired: Record that has already matured relative of the specified Expiry Date
elaboration.Deleted: The identifier is deleted and no longer active
elaboration.Deprecated: The record does not meet the requirements of the product template

StatusReason.title: Status Reason
StatusReason.description: The reason for UPI Status change

ClassificationType.title: Classification Type
ClassificationType.description: Indicates the type of security using ISO 10962 standard, Classification of Financial Instruments (CFI code) values. ISO 10962 is maintained by ANNA (Association of National Numbering Agencies) acting as Registration Authority

ShortName.title: Short Name
ShortName.description: Short name of financial instrument in accordance with ISO 18774

UnderlyingAssetType.title: Underlying Asset Type
UnderlyingAssetType.description: The type of the underlying asset as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

NotionalCurrency.title: Notional Currency
NotionalCurrency.description: Currency in which the notional is denominated. Usage: Within MiFIR, in the case of an interest rate or currency derivative contract, this will be the notional currency of leg 1 or the currency 1 of the pair. Within MiFIR, in the case of swaptions where the underlying swap is single-currency, this will be the notional currency of the underlying swap. For swaptions where the underlying is multi-currency, this will be the notional currency of leg 1 of the swap

OtherNotionalCurrency.title: Other Notional Currency
OtherNotionalCurrency.description: In the case of multi-currency or cross-currency swaps the currency in which leg 2 of the contract is denominated; For swaptions where the underlying swap is multi-currency, the currency in which leg 2 of the swap is denominated

UnderlierCharacteristic.title: Underlier Characteristic
UnderlierCharacteristic.description: An attribute that is used to specify whether the product is based on a single or multiple underliers.

elaboration.Single: In case the product has single underlier
elaboration.Basket: In case the product has multiple underliers

ReferenceRate.title: Reference Rate
ReferenceRate.description: Identifies the reference index for the instrument

ReferenceRateTermValue.title: Reference Rate Term Value
ReferenceRateTermValue.description: Tenor value of the first leg reference rate

ReferenceRateTermUnit.title: Reference Rate Term Unit
ReferenceRateTermUnit.description: Tenor unit of the first leg reference rate

OtherLegUnderlierCharacteristic.title: Other Leg Underlier Characteristic
OtherLegUnderlierCharacteristic.description: An attribute that is used to specify whether the product is based on a single or multiple underliers.

elaboration.Single: In case the product has single underlier
elaboration.Basket: In case the product has multiple underliers

OtherLegReferenceRate.title: Other Leg Reference Rate
OtherLegReferenceRate.description: The floating rate index of 2nd leg (for basis swaps)

OtherLegReferenceRateTermValue.title: Other Leg Reference Rate Term Value
OtherLegReferenceRateTermValue.description: Tenor value of the other leg reference rate

OtherLegReferenceRateTermUnit.title: Other Leg Reference Rate Term Unit
OtherLegReferenceRateTermUnit.description: Tenor unit of the other leg reference rate

ReturnorPayoutTrigger.title: Return or Payout Trigger
ReturnorPayoutTrigger.description: The Return or payout Trigger as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

elaboration.Price: price return equity swap, similar to a total return swap, except that dividends are not passed through to the buyer
elaboration.Dividend: a fixed-term contract between two parties where one party will make an interest rate payment for each interval and the other party will pay the total dividends received as pay-out by a selected underlying asset
elaboration.Variance: a forward swap that uses the variance (being the volatility squared) of an underlying's price movement over a period as the basis for the payoff calculation
elaboration.Volatility: the variability of movements in a security or underlying instrument's price; it is a measure of the amount by which an asset's price is expected to fluctuate over a given period of time; it is normally measured by the annual standard deviation of daily price changes
elaboration.Total Return: the total economic return of an underlying asset is transferred from one party (total return buyer) to another (total return seller); total return seller takes on the risk of negative changes in market value of the reference asset, and pays any positive cash flow to the buyer such as coupon, capital gains or dividends of the reference asset
elaboration.Contract for Difference (CFD): a cash settled total return swap or forward where the parties agree to exchange on the maturity of the contract the difference between the opening price and closing price of the underlying

UnderlierCharacteristic.description: An attribute that is used to specify whether the product is based on a single or multiple underliers.

elaboration.Single: In case the product has single underlier
elaboration.Basket: In case the product has multiple underliers

UnderlyingInstrumentLEI.description: In case the instrument is referring to an issuer, rather than to one single instrument, the LEI code of the Issuer

DebtSeniority.description: Indicates the seniority of the debt, or debt basket or index underlying a derivative

UnderlyingInstrumentIndex.description: Name of the index on which the financial instrument is based

UnderlyingCreditIndexSeries.description: The series identifier of a credit default swap index

UnderlyingCreditIndexSeriesPROP.description: The series identifier of a credit default swap index

NotionalCurrency.title: Notional Currency
NotionalCurrency.description: Currency in which the notional is denominated. Usage: Within MiFIR, in the case of an interest rate or currency derivative contract, this will be the notional currency of leg 1 or the currency 1 of the pair. Within MiFIR, in the case of swaptions where the underlying swap is single-currency, this will be the notional currency of the underlying swap. For swaptions where the underlying is multi-currency, this will be the notional currency of leg 1 of the swap

OtherNotionalCurrency.title: Other Notional Currency
OtherNotionalCurrency.description: In the case of multi-currency or cross-currency swaps the currency in which leg 2 of the contract is denominated; For swaptions where the underlying swap is multi-currency, the currency in which leg 2 of the swap is denominated

DeliveryType.title: Delivery Type
DeliveryType.description: The Delivery Type as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

elaboration.Cash: the discharge of an obligation by payment or receipt of a net cash amount instead of payment or delivery by both parties
elaboration.Physical: the meeting of a settlement obligation under a derivative contract through the receipt or delivery of the actual underlying instrument(s) instead of through cash settlement
